name: APT3
descr: [APT3](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0022) is a China-based threat group that researchers have attributed to China's Ministry of State Security.(Citation: FireEye Clandestine Wolf)(Citation: Recorded Future APT3 May 2017) This group is responsible for the campaigns known as Operation Clandestine Fox, Operation Clandestine Wolf, and Operation Double Tap.(Citation: FireEye Clandestine Wolf)(Citation: FireEye Operation Double Tap) As of June 2015, the group appears to have shifted from targeting primarily US victims to primarily political organizations in Hong Kong.(Citation: Symantec Buckeye)

subtechniques.name: Local Account
subtechniques.descr: [APT3](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0022) has used a tool that can obtain info about local and global group users, power users, and administrators.(Citation: Symantec Buckeye)

subtechniques.name: Additional Local or Domain Groups
subtechniques.descr: [APT3](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0022) has been known to add created accounts to local admin groups to maintain elevated access.(Citation: aptsim)

subtechniques.name: Archive via Utility
subtechniques.descr: [APT3](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0022) has used tools to compress data before exfilling it.(Citation: aptsim)

subtechniques.name: Registry Run Keys / Startup Folder
subtechniques.descr: [APT3](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0022) places scripts in the startup folder for persistence.(Citation: FireEye Operation Double Tap)

subtechniques.name: Password Cracking
subtechniques.descr: [APT3](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0022) has been known to brute force password hashes to be able to leverage plain text credentials.(Citation: APT3 Adversary Emulation Plan)

subtechniques.name: PowerShell
subtechniques.descr: [APT3](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0022) has used PowerShell on victim systems to download and run payloads after exploitation.(Citation: FireEye Operation Double Tap)

subtechniques.name: Windows Command Shell
subtechniques.descr: An [APT3](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0022) downloader uses the Windows command "cmd.exe" /C whoami. The group also uses a tool to execute commands on remote computers.(Citation: FireEye Operation Double Tap)(Citation: Symantec Buckeye)

subtechniques.name: Local Account
subtechniques.descr: [APT3](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0022) has been known to create or enable accounts, such as support_388945a0.(Citation: aptsim)

subtechniques.name: Windows Service
subtechniques.descr: [APT3](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0022) has a tool that creates a new service for persistence.(Citation: FireEye Operation Double Tap)

subtechniques.name: Credentials from Web Browsers
subtechniques.descr: [APT3](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0022) has used tools to dump passwords from browsers.(Citation: Symantec Buckeye)

technique_table_data.name: Data from Local System
technique_table_data.descr: [APT3](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0022) will identify Microsoft Office documents on the victim's computer.(Citation: aptsim)

subtechniques.name: Local Data Staging
subtechniques.descr: [APT3](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0022) has been known to stage files for exfiltration in a single location.(Citation: aptsim)

subtechniques.name: Accessibility Features
subtechniques.descr: [APT3](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0022) replaces the Sticky Keys binary C:\Windows\System32\sethc.exe for persistence.(Citation: aptsim)

technique_table_data.name: Exfiltration Over C2 Channel
technique_table_data.descr: [APT3](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0022) has a tool that exfiltrates data over the C2 channel.(Citation: FireEye Clandestine Fox)

technique_table_data.name: Exploitation for Client Execution
technique_table_data.descr: [APT3](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0022) has exploited the Adobe Flash Player vulnerability CVE-2015-3113 and Internet Explorer vulnerability CVE-2014-1776.(Citation: FireEye Clandestine Wolf)(Citation: FireEye Clandestine Fox)

technique_table_data.name: File and Directory Discovery
technique_table_data.descr: [APT3](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0022) has a tool that looks for files and directories on the local file system.(Citation: FireEye Clandestine Fox)(Citation: evolution of pirpi)

subtechniques.name: Hidden Window
subtechniques.descr: [APT3](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0022) has been known to use -WindowStyle Hidden to conceal [PowerShell](https://attack.mitre.org/techniques/T1059/001) windows.(Citation: FireEye Operation Double Tap)

subtechniques.name: DLL
subtechniques.descr: [APT3](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0022) has been known to side load DLLs with a valid version of Chrome with one of their tools.(Citation: FireEye Clandestine Fox)(Citation: FireEye Clandestine Fox Part 2)

subtechniques.name: File Deletion
subtechniques.descr: [APT3](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0022) has a tool that can delete files.(Citation: FireEye Clandestine Fox)

technique_table_data.name: Ingress Tool Transfer
technique_table_data.descr: [APT3](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0022) has a tool that can copy files to remote machines.(Citation: FireEye Clandestine Fox)

subtechniques.name: Keylogging
subtechniques.descr: [APT3](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0022) has used a keylogging tool that records keystrokes in encrypted files.(Citation: Symantec Buckeye)

subtechniques.name: Masquerade Account Name
subtechniques.descr: [APT3](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0022) has been known to create or enable accounts, such as support_388945a0.(Citation: aptsim)

technique_table_data.name: Multi-Stage Channels
technique_table_data.descr: An [APT3](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0022) downloader first establishes a SOCKS5 connection to 192.157.198[.]103 using TCP port 1913; once the server response is verified, it then requests a connection to 192.184.60[.]229 on TCP port 81.(Citation: FireEye Operation Double Tap)

technique_table_data.name: Non-Application Layer Protocol
technique_table_data.descr: An [APT3](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0022) downloader establishes SOCKS5 connections for its initial C2.(Citation: FireEye Operation Double Tap)

technique_table_data.name: Obfuscated Files or Information
technique_table_data.descr: [APT3](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0022) obfuscates files or information to help evade defensive measures.(Citation: Symantec Buckeye)

subtechniques.name: Software Packing
subtechniques.descr: [APT3](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0022) has been known to pack their tools.(Citation: APT3 Adversary Emulation Plan)(Citation: FireEye Clandestine Wolf)

subtechniques.name: Indicator Removal from Tools
subtechniques.descr: [APT3](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0022) has been known to remove indicators of compromise from tools.(Citation: APT3 Adversary Emulation Plan)

subtechniques.name: LSASS Memory
subtechniques.descr: [APT3](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0022) has used a tool to dump credentials by injecting itself into lsass.exe and triggering with the argument "dig."(Citation: Symantec Buckeye)

technique_table_data.name: Permission Groups Discovery
technique_table_data.descr: [APT3](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0022) has a tool that can enumerate the permissions associated with Windows groups.(Citation: Symantec Buckeye)

subtechniques.name: Spearphishing Link
subtechniques.descr: [APT3](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0022) has sent spearphishing emails containing malicious links.(Citation: FireEye Clandestine Wolf)

technique_table_data.name: Process Discovery
technique_table_data.descr: [APT3](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0022) has a tool that can list out currently running processes.(Citation: FireEye Clandestine Fox)(Citation: evolution of pirpi)

subtechniques.name: External Proxy
subtechniques.descr: An [APT3](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0022) downloader establishes SOCKS5 connections for its initial C2.(Citation: FireEye Operation Double Tap)

subtechniques.name: Remote Desktop Protocol
subtechniques.descr: [APT3](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0022) enables the Remote Desktop Protocol for persistence.(Citation: aptsim) [APT3](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0022) has also interacted with compromised systems to browse and copy files through RDP sessions.(Citation: Twitter Cglyer Status Update APT3 eml)

subtechniques.name: SMB/Windows Admin Shares
subtechniques.descr: [APT3](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0022) will copy files over to Windows Admin Shares (like ADMIN$) as part of lateral movement.(Citation: Symantec Buckeye)

technique_table_data.name: Remote System Discovery
technique_table_data.descr: [APT3](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0022) has a tool that can detect the existence of remote systems.(Citation: Symantec Buckeye)(Citation: FireEye Clandestine Fox)

subtechniques.name: Scheduled Task
subtechniques.descr: An [APT3](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0022) downloader creates persistence by creating the following scheduled task: schtasks /create /tn "mysc" /tr C:\Users\Public\test.exe /sc ONLOGON /ru "System".(Citation: FireEye Operation Double Tap)

subtechniques.name: Rundll32
subtechniques.descr: [APT3](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0022) has a tool that can run DLLs.(Citation: FireEye Clandestine Fox)

technique_table_data.name: System Information Discovery
technique_table_data.descr: [APT3](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0022) has a tool that can obtain information about the local system.(Citation: Symantec Buckeye)(Citation: evolution of pirpi)

technique_table_data.name: System Network Configuration Discovery
technique_table_data.descr: A keylogging tool used by [APT3](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0022) gathers network information from the victim, including the MAC address, IP address, WINS, DHCP server, and gateway.(Citation: Symantec Buckeye)(Citation: evolution of pirpi)

technique_table_data.name: System Network Connections Discovery
technique_table_data.descr: [APT3](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0022) has a tool that can enumerate current network connections.(Citation: Symantec Buckeye)(Citation: FireEye Clandestine Fox)(Citation: evolution of pirpi)

technique_table_data.name: System Owner/User Discovery
technique_table_data.descr: An [APT3](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0022) downloader uses the Windows command "cmd.exe" /C whoami to verify that it is running with the elevated privileges of “System.”(Citation: FireEye Operation Double Tap)

subtechniques.name: Credentials In Files
subtechniques.descr: [APT3](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0022) has a tool that can locate credentials in files on the file system such as those from Firefox or Chrome.(Citation: Symantec Buckeye)

subtechniques.name: Malicious Link
subtechniques.descr: [APT3](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0022) has lured victims into clicking malicious links delivered through spearphishing.(Citation: FireEye Clandestine Wolf)

subtechniques.name: Domain Accounts
subtechniques.descr: [APT3](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0022) leverages valid accounts after gaining credentials for use within the victim domain.(Citation: Symantec Buckeye)

techniques.name: Masquerading
techniques.sub_name: Match Legitimate Resource Name or Location

alias_descriptions.name: Gothic Panda
alias_descriptions.descr: (Citation: PWC Pirpi Scanbox) (Citation: Recorded Future APT3 May 2017) (Citation: Symantec Buckeye)

alias_descriptions.name: UPS Team
alias_descriptions.descr: (Citation: FireEye Clandestine Wolf) (Citation: Recorded Future APT3 May 2017) (Citation: Symantec Buckeye)

alias_descriptions.name: Threat Group-0110
alias_descriptions.descr: (Citation: Recorded Future APT3 May 2017) (Citation: Symantec Buckeye)

alias_descriptions.name: TG-0110
alias_descriptions.descr: (Citation: Recorded Future APT3 May 2017) (Citation: Symantec Buckeye)

FireEye Operation Double Tap.description: Moran, N., et al. (2014, November 21). Operation Double Tap. Retrieved January 14, 2016.

Symantec Buckeye.description: Symantec Security Response. (2016, September 6). Buckeye cyberespionage group shifts gaze from US to Hong Kong. Retrieved September 26, 2016.

APT3 Adversary Emulation Plan.description: Korban, C, et al. (2017, September). APT3 Adversary Emulation Plan. Retrieved January 16, 2018.

evolution of pirpi.description: Yates, M. (2017, June 18). APT3 Uncovered: The code evolution of Pirpi. Retrieved September 28, 2017.

FireEye Clandestine Fox.description: Chen, X., Scott, M., Caselden, D.. (2014, April 26). New Zero-Day Exploit targeting Internet Explorer Versions 9 through 11 Identified in Targeted Attacks. Retrieved January 14, 2016.

aptsim.description: valsmith. (2012, September 21). More on APTSim. Retrieved September 28, 2017.
